EnglishScore: For international applicants whose native language is not English, proof of English proficiency is required. To be considered for full admission, applicants must meet one of the following minimum proficiency scores: TOEFL iBT: 73, TOEFL PBT: 525, IELTS: 6.0, ELS: Level 112, Duolingo: 100, PTE Academic: 51.
Requirements: Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended; A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution; An overall undergraduate grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.00 on a 4.00 scale. If the undergraduate GPA is less than 3.00, the applicant may still be considered for admission by submitting a GMAT score of 500 or better. The analytical writing portion must have a score of 3.5 or better.
Description: The Master of Accountancy (M.Acc.) program at Northern Kentucky University is designed for students with an undergraduate degree in accounting who want to pursue a graduate business degree with a specialization in accounting. Our M.Acc. program provides students with the advanced knowledge and skills necessary to succeed in today’s competitive business environment and to help them meet the 150-hour requirement to sit for the CPA exam in Kentucky, Ohio, and most other states.
Accredidation: The Haile College of Business is accredited by AACSB International - The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. Additionally, the Department of Accounting and Business Law has earned a separate accounting accreditation from AACSB.
CostPerCredit: $745 per credit hour (Kentucky Resident); $1,152 per credit hour (Non-Resident)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Athletic Training
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Master of Science in Athletic Training (MSAT) program provides students with the required knowledge, skills and abilities to be eligible for national certification and state licensure as an athletic trainer. The MSAT is a full-time, two-year program that prepares students for a career in athletic training through a combination of didactic, laboratory and immersive clinical education experiences. The comprehensive didactic curriculum is based in evidence-based practice and includes courses in injury and illness prevention, wellness promotion, emergent care, examination and clinical diagnosis, therapeutic intervention and rehabilitation of injuries and medical conditions. A total of five immersive clinical education experiences provide students the opportunity to practice and apply the skills they learn in the classroom to a wide variety of patient populations under the direct supervision of a preceptor. All clinical experiences meet the requirements of the Commission on Accreditation of Athletic Training Education (CAATE) and will be in one of the following settings: college/university athletics, secondary school athletics, professional sports, orthopedic and primary care physician offices, outpatient rehabilitation clinics, industrial medicine, and performing arts. Students will also be required to complete a research project and successfully defend the results prior to graduation. Once certified and licensed, athletic trainers provide comprehensive patient care in a variety of settings. Athletic trainers (ATs) are health care professionals who collaborate with physicians to provide preventative services, emergency care, clinical diagnosis, therapeutic intervention and rehabilitation of injuries and medical conditions. ATs work with patients of all ages and abilities in a variety of settings including: hospitals, physician clinics, sports medicine clinics, secondary schools, colleges and universities, professional sports, performing arts, industrial settings, and military.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Athletic Training program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Athletic Training Education (CAATE).

EnglishScore: All international applicants must provide proof of English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL minimum score of 79 (internet-based) or 550 (paper-based), IELTS minimum score of 6.0, PTE minimum score of 53 (academic), Duolingo English Test minimum score of 105, or completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements:
Admission to the NKU MBA program is based on the following criteria:

A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution
A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
Conditional admission may be granted to students with GPAs between 2.5 and 2.99
Submission of GMAT or GRE score reports
GMAT/GRE waivers are available for candidates with:
An undergraduate GPA of 3.2 or higher from a regionally accredited institution OR
Five or more years of professional work experience OR
A terminal degree (e.g., JD, MD, PhD, etc.) OR
A master's degree in a business-related field OR
Active CPA license.
Two letters of recommendation (can be academic or professional)
A current resume
A 500-word statement of purpose
Description: The online Master of Business Administration (MBA) from Northern Kentucky University is a nationally ranked program designed to broaden your knowledge, skills and abilities in key areas of business and management. Taught by the same world-class faculty who teach on campus, our program provides you with a rich, rewarding academic experience that integrates real-world business challenges into the curriculum. Our online MBA program prepares you to navigate the business world from a management perspective and to overcome the challenges of an evolving global economy. With a focus on strategic leadership, management and decision-making, you will learn to utilize your business expertise to influence, lead and excel in any industry. In this program, you will develop the analytical skills to strategically manage a team, evaluate risk and opportunity, and understand how to drive your organization’s growth and profitability. You will emerge from our online MBA program as an innovative business leader, ready to create value for your organization and advance your career.
Accredidation: Northern Kentucky University's Haile/US Bank College of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB). Fewer than 5 percent of business schools worldwide have earned this hallmark of excellence in business education.

EnglishScore: For international applicants, proof of English proficiency is required. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT 79 or PBT 550, IELTS 6.0, ELS Level 112, Duolingo English Test 105, or Pearson Test of English (PTE) 55.
Requirements: Admission to the Master of Business Leadership and Innovation (MBLI) is selective. The admissions committee reviews each candidate’s application package and considers all components of the application to determine the candidate’s overall qualifications for the program. Applicants must meet the admission requirements of the graduate school as well as the program-specific requirements listed below: A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher. OR an undergraduate GPA between 2.5-2.99 with three years of progressive work or military experience. A current resume detailing professional experience. A personal statement video (2-4 minutes in length).
Fees: $22,950 for the entire 30-credit-hour program ($765 per credit hour)
Description: The Master of Business Leadership and Innovation (MBLI) is a 30-credit hour online program for working professionals who want to sharpen their leadership and innovation skills. In this program, students develop strategic leadership, problem-solving, and decision-making skills that can be directly applied to their careers.
Accredidation: The Haile College of Business is accredited by AACSB International.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Cardiovascular Perfusion
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Master of Science in Cardiovascular Perfusion at Northern Kentucky University is a 21-month, 77-credit hour program that provides students with the didactic and clinical experience needed to become a certified clinical perfusionist. Students are educated in all aspects of cardiopulmonary bypass and related technologies such as extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) and ventricular assist device (VAD) management. Graduates of the program are eligible for board certification through the American Board of Cardiovascular Perfusion.
Accredidation: The Northern Kentucky University Cardiovascular Perfusion Program has been granted initial accreditation by the Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (www.caahep.org) upon the recommendation of the Accreditation Committee for Perfusion Education (AC-PE).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Clinical Mental Health Counseling
EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required of all applicants whose native language is not English, regardless of citizenship. This requirement is waived for applicants who have received a degree from a U.S. college or university. NKU accepts the following as proof of English proficiency: TOEFL: 79 iBT (550 PBT), IELTS: 6.5, ELS Language Centers: Level 112, Duolingo English Test: 105, Pearson Test of English (PTE): 58.
Requirements: In addition to the online application for graduate admission and application fee, the following are required: Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Three letters of recommendation. A statement of purpose outlining your career goals and reasons for seeking admission to the program. A resume highlighting relevant experience.
Description: NKU's Master of Science in Clinical Mental Health Counseling is a 60-credit hour program accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP). The program is designed to prepare compassionate and self-reflective counselors to work with diverse clients in a variety of community and clinical settings. Students who complete the program are eligible for counseling licensure in Kentucky, Ohio, Indiana, and many other states. All courses in the counseling program are taught by core faculty who have professional experience as licensed counselors. The program has three main components: a core of counseling classes, including a practicum of at least 100 hours in the field; specialization classes that develop specific knowledge and skills; and an internship of at least 600 hours in a clinical setting.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Computer Science
EnglishScore: Students for whom English is not their primary language must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) score of 525 (paper-based) or 70 (Internet-based); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.0; Duolingo score of 95; ELS Language Centers level 112; Successful completion of NKU’s English as a Second Language (ESL) program; A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university.
Description: The Master of Science in computer science program is a 30-credit-hour program that builds on a bachelor’s degree in computer science to provide students with advanced knowledge and skills in the computing discipline. The program helps prepare students for a career in the computing field as well as for further study at the doctoral level. Students receive a broad background in the areas of algorithms, computer architecture, operating systems, and programming languages, and they also have the opportunity to take a variety of electives in areas such as artificial intelligence, computer vision, data science, database systems, high performance computing, networks, and security.

Cybersecurity professionals are in high demand as technology continues to evolve and businesses and organizations adapt to a changing global climate. Northern Kentucky University's online Master of Science in Cybersecurity program prepares you to meet that need, whether you are seeking a career in the field or an advanced role in your current organization. Designed for working professionals, this 100% online program is flexible, convenient, and affordable. You will gain in-demand skills in cybersecurity and technology that you can apply right away in your career. Our M.S. in Cybersecurity online program provides you with in-depth knowledge of all aspects of cybersecurity, including the latest techniques, policies, ethical and legal issues, and risk assessment and management. You will gain a clear understanding of the full scope of security issues from different points of view and learn to think on a higher level as you design complete information security systems. In this cybersecurity master's program, you will: Learn to secure data and information, protect networks, and assess system vulnerabilities. Gain practical skills in risk management and threat analysis, network security, computer forensics, and cryptography. Prepare for professional certification exams such as CISSP®, CEH, and CHFI. Discover how to create and implement security plans and disaster recovery plans.
Accredidation: Earn your degree from a National Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense Education (CAE-CDE), a designation awarded by the National Security Agency and the Department of Homeland Security.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by providing ONE of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) score of 79 (IBT) or 550 (PBT); IELTS (International English Language Testing System) score of 6.0; Duolingo score of 105; ELS (English Language Services) Language Center's Level 112; or PTE (Pearson Test of English) Academic with a score of 53. This requirement is waived for applicants who have completed a bachelor's or master's degree from a U.S. institution or a country where English is the official language.
Concentration: Curriculum and Instruction, Educational Leadership (Principal Program), Gifted and Talented Education, Instructional Computer Technology, Literacy P-12, Reading/Literacy Specialist P-12, School Librarian, Special Education - Learning and Behavior Disorders P-12, Teacher as Leader in a Culturally and Linguistically Diverse World
Description: The Master of Arts in Education (M.A.Ed.) degree program is designed to meet the advanced professional needs of P-12 teachers and other school personnel. The program supports the professional growth of educators and helps them expand their knowledge and skills in specific areas of education. The M.A.Ed. is an all-online program and is offered in nine different concentrations, and also includes additional endorsements and a certificate. The M.A.Ed. can be completed in as few as 18 months.
Accredidation:
Northern Kentucky University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) to award associate, baccalaureate, masters, and doctorate degrees. Questions about the accreditation of Northern Kentucky University may be directed in writing to the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges at 1866 Southern Lane, Decatur, GA 30033-4097, by calling (404) 679-4500, or by using information available on SACSCOC’s website (www.sacscoc.org).

The College of Education at Northern Kentucky University is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Educational Leadership
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide evidence of English proficiency. This can be demonstrated through one of the following: TOEFL iBT minimum score of 79, IELTS minimum score of 6.0, PTE minimum score of 53, Duolingo English Test minimum score of 110, or completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Description: The Master of Arts in Educational Leadership (principal preparation) program is a 30-credit hour, fully online program that leads to a recommendation for principal certification in Kentucky. The program combines core educational leadership content with field-based experiences to prepare candidates with the knowledge, skills, and dispositions to be highly effective school leaders.
Accredidation: Northern Kentucky University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC). The College of Education programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $1,000 (Graduate Student Opportunity Grant); $2,000 (URM Graduate Student Scholarship)

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Duolingo English Test, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic, or complete ELS Language Center's Level 112.
Requirements: A completed application to the Office of Graduate Education. A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution, including the equivalent of an undergraduate minor in English (18 semester hours of English beyond first-year composition). An overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher. Applicants with GPAs below 3.0 may be granted conditional admission. A 2-3 page statement of purpose that describes your reasons for pursuing graduate study in English at NKU and your academic and professional goals. A 10-15 page, double-spaced critical writing sample with a works cited page that demonstrates your ability to conduct research and construct a sophisticated, complex argument about a literary or rhetorical text. Three letters of recommendation from former professors or others able to comment on your academic abilities and potential for success in a graduate program. Resume/CV (optional)
Description: The Master of Arts in English at Northern Kentucky University offers students the opportunity to deepen their skills in close reading, critical thinking, and written expression in small, seminar-style classes taught by an award-winning faculty of active scholars and creative writers. Our M.A. in English program helps students expand their knowledge of the diverse traditions of literature in English. The program also provides excellent preparation for doctoral study in English or a related field; for a teaching career, including at the community college level; and for professions that require advanced skills in research, analysis, and communication, such as law, editing, public relations, technical writing, and marketing.
CostPerCredit: $681 per credit hour (KY Resident); $963 per credit hour (Non-Resident)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Exercise Science
EnglishScore: International students whose native language is not English are required to provide proof of English proficiency. This requirement can be satisfied by submitting one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT minimum score of 73; International English Language Testing System (IELTS) academic version minimum score of 6.0; Pearson Test of English (PTE) academic minimum score of 49; Duolingo minimum score of 100; Completion of ELS Language Centers level 112.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Master of Science in Exercise Science program at Northern Kentucky University is designed to prepare highly-qualified professionals to work in athletic, clinical, and industrial settings. This is a 100% online program and consists of a 30-33 credit hour curriculum depending on whether the student chooses to pursue a thesis, an internship, or a capstone project. The Master of Science in Exercise Science online program is dedicated to developing exercise science professionals who are leaders in their respective fields through demonstrated evidence-based knowledge and skills. Our program also provides students with the prerequisite coursework to sit for certifications offered by the American College of Sports Medicine (ACSM), the National Strength & Conditioning Association (NSCA), and the National Academy of Sports Medicine (NASM).
Accredidation: NKU’s online master’s in exercise science program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Health Informatics
EnglishScore: All students for whom English is not their native language must demonstrate proficiency in English. This can be satisfied by submitting a test score from TOEFL (73 iBT or 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), Duolingo (100), or PTE (49), or through completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Master of Science in Health Informatics (MSHI) program is an interdisciplinary program that includes courses in health care, information systems, computer science, and business. It is a graduate program that is 100 percent online. The program is designed to meet the growing need for informatics professionals in the health care industry. It provides students with specialized skills and knowledge in health informatics. Health informatics professionals are skilled in the capture, management and use of health care data and information to improve the process and outcomes of patient care. In this program, students develop the skills to be leaders in the new information-intensive health care environment. The curriculum has a strong focus on project management, systems analysis, and data analytics. Students have an opportunity to personalize their program through their choice of practicum experience and capstone project. In addition, students can take approved electives. The program offers flexible options for completing both the practicum and the capstone project. Evidence-based practice, professionalism, communication, and leadership skills are integrated in all courses throughout the curriculum.
Accredidation: The Health Informatics accreditor of Northern Kentucky University is the Commission on Accreditation for Health Informatics and Information Management Education (CAHIIM). The College’s accreditation for Master degree in Health Informatics has been reaffirmed through 2029-2030. All inquiries about the program’s accreditation status should be directed by mail to CAHIIM, 200 East Randolph Street, Suite 5100, Chicago, IL, 60601; by phone at (312) 235-3255; or by email at info@cahiim.org.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Industrial-Organizational Psychology
EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met with one of the following: TOEFL iBT score of 73, IELTS score of 6.0, Duolingo English Test score of 100, Pearson Test of English (PTE) academic score of 49, or ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements:
Admission is competitive. Meeting the minimum requirements does not guarantee admission. Decisions are based on a holistic review of the applicant’s materials.

Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores (verbal, quantitative, and analytical writing) must be submitted. Applicants should score at or above the 50th percentile on the verbal and quantitative sections to be competitive. The GRE requirement is waived for applicants who have a terminal degree (e.g., Ph.D., J.D., M.D.) from an accredited institution in the U.S.

A grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.000 on a 4.000 scale for all undergraduate work and a GPA of at least 3.200 for all psychology courses.

An undergraduate degree in psychology is preferred but not required. A minimum of 18 semester hours in psychology is required. Required coursework includes a course in statistics and a course in research methods. The statistics and research methods courses must be passed with a grade of B- or better.

Three letters of recommendation from individuals (e.g., former professors) who are in a position to make an academic appraisal of the applicant. At least two letters should be from former professors.

A statement of purpose (approximately 500 words) that describes the applicant’s professional goals, and indicates how the M.S. in I-O Psychology will help them achieve those goals. The statement should also describe any relevant research or work experience.

A curriculum vitae (CV) or resume that summarizes the applicant’s educational and employment history, as well as any relevant experiences (e.g., research, publications, presentations).

Application deadline for admission to the fall semester is February 1.
Fees: $29,565 for KY Residents (entire program); $43,290 for Non-Residents (entire program)
Description: The Master of Science in Industrial-Organizational (I-O) Psychology program is a 39-42 credit hour program designed to prepare students for careers in business, industry, government, and other organizational settings. The program is designed in accordance with the training guidelines set forth by the Society of Industrial and Organizational Psychology (SIOP). The I-O psychology program is a full-time program with a fall admission only. All classes are held in the evenings to accommodate both traditional students and students who wish to maintain full-time employment while completing their degree. The typical student enrolled full-time will complete the program in two years. I-O psychology is the scientific study of the workplace and the application of psychological principles to workplace issues. I-O psychologists are scientist-practitioners who are trained to be competent in both research and application. They use the scientific method to better understand human behavior at work, and then they apply that knowledge to real-world organizational problems. I-O psychologists focus on a wide variety of issues. For example, I-O psychologists help organizations hire qualified and suitable employees, train and develop employees, manage and appraise employee performance, ensure fair and equitable treatment of employees, create and implement effective organizational development and change interventions, and promote employee health, safety, and well-being. The I-O psychology program at NKU provides students with a comprehensive understanding of I-O psychology theories, methods, and research. Our program is designed to develop students’ applied skills through coursework, a required practicum, and opportunities for applied research experience (e.g., student consulting projects, thesis). Our students are trained to be both critical consumers and producers of I-O psychology research.
CostPerCredit: $657 per credit hour (KY Resident); $962 per credit hour (Non-Resident)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Information Systems
EnglishScore: International applicants must provide proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT 79 or PBT 550, IELTS 6.0, Duolingo 100, Pearson Test of English (PTE) 53, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Description: The Master of Science in Information Systems (MSIS) program prepares students for leadership positions in the information systems/technology field. The program is designed for students who desire to update and enhance their skills and knowledge in the analysis, design, development, and management of information systems. The program provides a balance between technical and managerial concepts. In addition to advanced technical topics such as systems analysis and design, database management, and data communications, the curriculum addresses key management issues such as project management, technology management, and information security. Students may choose from one of three concentrations: Business Analytics, Business Informatics, or Cybersecurity.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Interdisciplinary Studies
EnglishScore: For international applicants whose native language is not English, proof of English proficiency is required. This can be demonstrated with a minimum score of 79 on TOEFL (iBT, MyBest, Essentials Online, and Home Edition), 6.0 on IELTS, 53 on PTE Academic, or 105 on Duolingo. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112 or NKU's American English Language Program (AELP) also fulfills this requirement. Waivers may be available.
Requirements:
Students who seek admission to the Master of Arts in interdisciplinary studies program must satisfy all admission requirements of the university for graduate study. Admission to the MAIS program is based on a holistic review of the following application materials:
1. Graduate application and fee.
2. Official transcripts of all undergraduate and graduate work from regionally accredited institutions. An undergraduate grade point average of at least 3.000 on a 4.000 scale is required for unconditional admission. Students with at least a 2.500 GPA may be admitted conditionally.
3. Two letters of recommendation.
4. Statement of purpose that describes the student’s motivation and intellectual interests as well as a preliminary plan of study for the proposed interdisciplinary degree.
5. A scholarly writing sample.
6. Resume or curriculum vitae.
Description: The Master of Arts in Interdisciplinary Studies (MAIS) program is designed for students whose academic interests cross traditional disciplinary boundaries. It allows students to create an individualized and flexible program of graduate study by drawing on coursework from across the university. Students complete 33 hours of graduate coursework from two to three different academic disciplines and write a master’s thesis. The master’s thesis allows students to engage in an in-depth study of a topic from an interdisciplinary perspective. The MAIS program attracts a wide array of students, from recent college graduates to working professionals and lifelong learners. The program allows students to customize a plan of study that suits their interests and needs. Students acquire skills in critical thinking and writing that can be transferred across an array of employment sectors. Students graduate with a deeper and richer understanding of their chosen topics of study, which prepares them for a variety of pursuits as they advance their personal and professional goals.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide evidence of English proficiency. This can be demonstrated with a TOEFL score of 73 (iBT) or 525 (PBT), IELTS score of 6.0, PTE score of 49, Duolingo score of 100, or ELS completion of Level 112 with a B or higher.
Concentration: General, Business Law, Compliance, Health Care Law
Description: The Master of Legal Studies (MLS) degree is for individuals who want to obtain a deeper understanding of the law but do not want to practice it. Students learn how to identify and address legal issues through course work covering a broad base of legal topics. The 30 credit-hour degree can be completed entirely online in as few as two years. Students are taught by the same law professors who teach Juris Doctor students, and they have the same academic support services.
Accredidation: The NKU Chase College of Law MLS program has received acquiescence from the American Bar Association (ABA) and is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC).

EnglishScore: For international applicants, proof of English proficiency is required. This can be demonstrated through a TOEFL iBT score of 79, IELTS score of 6.5, Duolingo score of 110, PTE score of 53, or completion of ELS level 112. A bachelor's or higher degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution or from a country where English is the official language of instruction also fulfills this requirement.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Concentration: ['Adult-Gerontology Nurse Practitioner (AGNP)', 'Family Nurse Practitioner (FNP)', 'Nurse Educator (NED)', 'Nursing Executive Leadership (NEL)', 'Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP)']
Description: The Master of Science in Nursing (M.S.N.) program prepares graduates for advanced roles in nursing. The M.S.N. program is designed for the registered nurse who has a Bachelor of Science in Nursing degree and is ready to advance his or her career.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master’s degree program in nursing, and doctor of nursing practice program at Northern Kentucky University are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

EnglishScore: International students must satisfy the minimum university requirements for English proficiency. According to the university's international graduate admissions page, this can be demonstrated with a minimum TOEFL iBT of 73, IELTS of 6.0, Duolingo English Test of 100, ELS Level 112 Certificate, or PTE of 49.
Description:
The MPA program prepares a diverse student body to be leaders in public service by providing the knowledge, skills and abilities to ethically and effectively address critical community issues. The program prepares students through an applied academic course of study which supports their professional careers as leaders and managers in government, and in nonprofit agencies at the local, regional, state and national levels.

The MPA program offers a 36 credit hour generalist curriculum for pre-service students and those individuals already employed in the public and non-profit sectors who wish to advance in their careers. The core courses emphasize skills and knowledge appropriate for leaders in the public and nonprofit sectors in the areas of public management, policy analysis and evaluation, budgeting and financial management, public personnel management, legal issues and research and quantitative methods. A required internship or research project provides a culminating experience through which students can apply the knowledge they have gained.

A variety of elective choices allow students to pursue areas of interest. Electives may be chosen from graduate courses offered in the MPA program, from other related graduate programs at NKU, or from courses offered by our partner institutions in the Greater Cincinnati Consortium of Colleges and Universities.
Accredidation: The Northern Kentucky University Master of Public Administration Program is accredited by the Network of Schools of Public Policy, Affairs, and Administration (NASPAA) Commission on Peer Review and Accreditation and is listed on the Annual Roster of Accredited Programs in conformity with NASPAA standards.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Public History
EnglishScore: International graduate applicants must prove English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL (79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.5), ELS (Level 112 completion), Duolingo (105), or PTE Academic (53).
Description:
The Master of Arts in Public History at NKU is an innovative, nationally recognized program that combines traditional historical study with hands-on, real-world experiences through internships, service-learning opportunities, and class projects for local museums, archives, and other non-profits. The program prepares students for history-related careers at museums, archives, libraries, cultural agencies, and in historic preservation, heritage tourism, documentary filmmaking, corporate history, and policy analysis.

The program is small (usually 25-30 students), providing a high degree of student-faculty interaction. We offer small graduate seminars, a flexible curriculum that allows students to choose their own course of study, and a variety of career-building activities, including conferences, workshops, and guest lectures.

Students may pursue the degree on a full- or part-time basis. Full-time students can finish in two years. Part-time students typically finish in three-four years. Courses are offered on a rotating basis, usually in the evenings, to accommodate working professionals.
CostPerCredit: $667 per credit hour (in-state); $960 per credit hour (out-of-state)

ProgramName: Master of Arts in School Counseling
Requirements:
Admission to the M.A. in School Counseling program requires the following:
1. NKU Graduate School Application
2. Transcripts from all colleges/universities attended. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale is required for admission.
3. Graduate Record Exam (GRE): The GRE is waived for candidates whose cumulative undergraduate GPA is 3.0 or higher. If your undergraduate GPA is between 2.5 and 2.99, you must take the GRE and earn a combined score of 286 on the verbal and quantitative sections OR score in the 35th percentile or higher on the verbal, quantitative, AND analytical writing sections.
4. Three Letters of Recommendation
5. Statement of Purpose and Intent: A 2-3 page, double-spaced, typed statement describing your academic and career goals and why you are choosing school counseling as a profession.
6. Writing Sample: A scholarly writing sample of your best work, preferably in APA style (7th edition).
7. Vita or Resume: A vita or resume including your educational and professional background and experiences.
8. Interview: After all application materials are received, select candidates will be invited for an interview.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The School Counseling Program at Northern Kentucky University prepares counselors to work in a variety of school settings, elementary, middle, and high school. In addition to the required core classes, students are trained in developmental counseling, college and career readiness, consultation, and program development and evaluation. Students complete a 100 hour practicum and a 600 hour internship in a school setting.
Accredidation: The School Counseling program is accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP) and The Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

EnglishScore: All applicants from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following official scores: TOEFL iBT: 79, TOEFL PBT: 550, IELTS: 6.5, Duolingo: 110, PTE: 53, or ELS: Level 112 with a grade of B or higher. Applicants are exempt if they have received a baccalaureate or graduate degree from a college or university in the United States or from a country on the English proficiency waiver list.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Concentration: Clinical Social Work, Community and Organizational Practice Social Work
Description: Northern Kentucky University's Master of Social Work is a graduate program that focuses on community based practice to address the needs of the Northern Kentucky and Greater Cincinnati region. It is designed to prepare social workers to practice with individuals, families,groups, organizations, and communities through a curriculum focused on community based practice. The program encourages a learning environment in which students can develop the required skills and knowledge for effective practice through course work and internships. The NKU MSW program offers a generalist year curriculum (foundation) and a specialized year curriculum (advanced). Students may be eligible for advanced standing if they have a bachelor's degree in social work from a Council on Social Work Education accredited program.
Accredidation: Northern Kentucky University's Master of Social Work program is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).

DeadlineDate: July 1 (for fall), November 1 (for spring), April 1 (for summer)
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting ONE of the following: TOEFL iBT score of 73 (no subscore below 15); TOEFL PBT score of 525 (with at least 50 in each section); IELTS score of 6.0 (no subscore below 5.5); Duolingo English Test score of 100; PTE Academic score of 49; ELS, completion of level 112.
Requirements:
Completed online application for admission to graduate study and non-refundable application fee.
Official transcripts showing the conferral of a baccalaureate or more advanced degree from a regionally accredited institution with a minimum cumulative grade point average of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale. If the cumulative GPA is below 2.75, the applicant may be admitted on a conditional basis provided the GPA in the last thirty (30) hours of course work is 3.0 or higher.
Official transcripts of all undergraduate and graduate work from each institution attended.
Official score report for the Graduate Record Examination (GRE): Verbal 150, Quantitative 143, and Analytical Writing 4.0. MAT scores may be submitted in lieu of the GRE. Score of 385 on the MAT. *(The GRE/MAT requirement is waived for applicants who have a 3.0 cumulative GPA)*
Official score report for the Praxis Core Academic Skills for Educators Tests (or ACT/SAT equivalent scores).
Three letters of recommendation.
A two-page, double-spaced essay discussing (1) the applicant's reasons for wanting to become a teacher and (2) the dispositions the applicant possesses that would make him or her an effective teacher.
For candidates seeking P-12 or 5-12 certification, official transcripts must reflect a major in the content area in which certification is being sought or passing scores on the appropriate Praxis II content area exam.
Interview with MAT admission committee.
Concentration: ['Elementary Education (P-5)', 'Middle Grades Education (5-9) in English, mathematics, science, and social studies', 'Secondary Education (8-12) in English, mathematics, social studies, biology, chemistry, earth science, and physics', 'P-12 in art, music, physical education, Spanish, French, German, and theatre']
Description: The Master of Arts in Teaching (MAT) program is for individuals who have a bachelor's degree in a field other than education and want to become a certified teacher. The program offers several certification options in elementary, middle grades, secondary, and P-12 education. The program can be completed in as little as 12 months in an accelerated format or at a more traditional pace to allow for continued employment. Program faculty work closely with students to create a plan that fits their needs and goals.
Accredidation: The teacher education programs at Northern Kentucky University are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
CostPerCredit: Online: $545 per credit hour. On-campus: $656 per credit hour (KY Resident), $955 per credit hour (Non-Resident)

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by ONE of the following: TOEFL iBT score of 73; TOEFL paper-based score of 525; IELTS score of 6.0; Duolingo English test score of 105; ELS Level 112 with a grade of B or higher; PTE Academic score of 55.
Requirements: Applications for the Doctor of Occupational Therapy (OTD) program must be submitted through the Occupational Therapist Centralized Application Service (OTCAS). The OTCAS application will be available in mid-July. The application deadline is February 1st. Admission to the program is based upon the following: A minimum overall and prerequisite GPA of 3.0. Completion of the program prerequisite coursework with a C or better. Completion of 30 hours of observation with an OT. Three letters of recommendation are required through OTCAS. Personal Statement/Essay: Each applicant will be required to answer essay questions within OTCAS. Interview: Competitive applicants will be invited for a virtual interview. GRE is not required. Completion of a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution prior to beginning the program. Resume (submitted through OTCAS). Technical Standards: All candidates are required to review the Technical Standards for the OTD program and verify that they can meet the standards with or without reasonable accommodations.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: Northern Kentucky University's Doctor of Occupational Therapy (OTD) program is the first of its kind in the Commonwealth of Kentucky, as it is the only entry-level doctoral program offered by a public university. The OTD Program prepares students to be evidence-based, occupation-centered practitioners, leaders, and advocates. The curriculum is built on a strong foundation of knowledge in the science of occupation. Students learn to implement the occupational therapy process with individuals, groups, and populations in a variety of practice settings. Throughout the program, students have multiple opportunities to learn by doing in the classroom, in the community, and through fieldwork experiences. Two final components of the program are the capstone experience and capstone project. These components allow students to further develop skills as a leader, advocate, and practitioner.
Accredidation: The entry-level occupational therapy doctoral degree program has applied for accreditation and has been granted Candidacy Status by the Accreditation Council for Occupational Therapy Education (ACOTE) of the American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA), located at 6116 Executive Boulevard, Suite 200, North Bethesda, MD 20852-4929. ACOTE’s telephone number c/o AOTA is (301) 652-AOTA and its Web address is www.acoteonline.org.

ProgramName: Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership
Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership (Online Accelerated)
EnglishScore: For international applicants whose native language is not English, an English proficiency exam is required. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT 79 or PBT 550, IELTS 6.5, PTE Academic 58, Duolingo English Test 105, or completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112. Exemptions may apply.
Description: The Doctor of Education (Ed.D.) in Educational Leadership is an accelerated online program designed to prepare leaders who can respond to the complex problems in P-12, higher education, and other organizational settings. This cohort-based program is built on a strong foundation of social justice and equity. You’ll be prepared for administrative, academic, and research roles that improve outcomes for all learners.
Accredidation: NKU's College of Education has been accredited by CAEP (and its legacy agency NCATE) for more than 60 years.

ProgramName: Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership - Principal Certification (Online Accelerated)
EnglishScore: All applicants for whom English is a second language must provide evidence of English proficiency. This can be met by ONE of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) minimum score of 79 on the internet-based test or 550 on the paper-based test. International English Language Testing System (IELTS) minimum score of 6.0. ELS Language Centers - completion of level 112 of the intensive English for Academic Purposes program. Duolingo English Test - minimum score of 100.
Requirements: Completed online application and non-refundable application fee. A current resume that documents at least three years of professional experience in an educational setting such as a P-12 school or district, higher education institution, or education-related governmental or non-profit organization. Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended with the following: Master’s or other advanced degree in an appropriate area of professional practice from a regionally accredited institution with a minimum GPA of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale; Undergraduate degree from a regionally accredited institution with a minimum GPA of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale. Three professional letters of recommendation that address the applicant’s potential for doctoral study and professional leadership. At least two of the references should be from supervisors who have directly observed your professional work and can attest to your commitment to equity. A 500-700-word statement of purpose describing how the NKU Ed.D. in Educational Leadership will help you achieve your professional goals. A writing sample demonstrating the applicant’s ability to use scholarly sources to analyze an educational problem. A successful interview with program faculty (select applicants will be invited to interview).
Description: The Doctor of Education (Ed.D.) in Educational Leadership is designed for practicing and aspiring leaders in P-12, higher education, and related educational organizations, such as non-profits and government agencies. The program is designed to develop leaders who are capable of responding to the changing needs of our educational organizations and our diverse society. As a student in this program, you will expand your leadership capacities and learn to lead change efforts through the application of improvement science and other research and data analysis methods. The program fosters a deep understanding of equity and social justice issues and will prepare you to be an advocate for all learners. The 54-credit hour Ed.D. program can be completed in as little as 36 months and is offered in an accelerated online format, allowing you to advance your career while maintaining your work and personal life.
Accredidation: The Ed.D. in Educational Leadership program is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

EnglishScore: All international students are required to submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting official score reports for one of the following exams: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 79 on the internet-based test (iBT), IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum score of 6.0, PTE (Pearson Test of English) Academic with a minimum score of 53, Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105, or ELS (English Language Services) completion of Level 112 with a grade of B or higher.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Concentration: ['Adult-Gero Acute Care Nurse Practitioner', 'Family Nurse Practitioner', 'Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner']
Description: The Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) degree is the new standard for advanced practice nursing education. NKU offers two pathways for DNP study: the post-master’s DNP and the BSN to DNP. The BSN to DNP program prepares graduates for certification in one of three advanced practice registered nursing (APRN) roles. The post-master’s DNP program prepares those who are already certified as APRNs at the highest level of nursing practice. Our DNP graduates are leaders in advanced clinical practice, applying evidence-based knowledge to reflect and resolve clinical practice problems and to improve healthcare outcomes.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and Doctor of Nursing Practice program at Northern Kentucky University are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

EnglishScore: All international students must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by providing ONE of the following: TOEFL: 79 internet-based (iBT), IELTS: 6.5, ELS: Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA, Duolingo: 105, PTE: 53.
Requirements: The Business Analytics graduate certificate requires a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants may be required to submit a graduate exam score (GMAT or GRE). The GMAT/GRE requirement is waived for applicants who have a 3.0 or greater GPA.
Fees: Total program cost is approximately $8,988 (12 credit hours at $749/credit hour for the online program)
Description: Data has become the world’s most valuable resource. Organizations of all types and sizes are looking for professionals who can interpret and analyze data and use it to help make sound business decisions. NKU’s online Graduate Certificate in Business Analytics will help you gain the most in-demand skills in a short period of time. Our curriculum is tailored for working professionals. We offer eight-week courses, with five different start dates throughout the year, so you can earn your certificate in as little as two semesters.
Accredidation: The Haile College of Business is accredited by AACSB International, a mark of excellence achieved by less than five percent of business schools worldwide.

EnglishScore: International students whose native language is not English must provide evidence of English proficiency by one of the options described in the current NKU Graduate Catalog. Accepted tests include TOEFL with a minimum score of 79 (iBT) or 550 (pBT), IELTS with a minimum overall band score of 6.5, Duolingo with a minimum score of 105, or PTE with a minimum score of 53.
Requirements: Applicants must meet the general requirements for admission to the Graduate School at NKU. A grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university. A statement of purpose (maximum one page) describing the applicant’s personal and professional goals and how earning the certificate in clinical research would help them achieve those goals. A professional resume. Submit a free application to the Office of Graduate Education. Submit official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended to the Office of Graduate Education.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The online Graduate Certificate in Clinical Research (GCCR) at Northern Kentucky University is a 12-credit hour program designed for working professionals who are interested in starting or advancing their careers in clinical research. The certificate includes a comprehensive curriculum on clinical trial design and execution, regulatory issues, and the business aspects of clinical research. Students will learn the essentials needed to initiate, manage, and monitor a clinical trial. The program is offered in 8-week formats and completely online to provide flexibility for the working professional. The curriculum also serves as a bridge for students who may be interested in pursuing a Master of Science in Health Science in the future.
CostPerCredit: $688 per credit hour for Kentucky residents (online) and $757 per credit hour for out-of-state residents (online).

Description: The 15-hour Graduate Certificate in Composition and Rhetoric helps high school English teachers and others interested in teaching writing at the university level learn foundational concepts in the teaching of writing. This certificate prepares students for careers in community colleges and teaching-focused universities, provides dual-credit credentialing for high school teachers, and offers a concentration for students in other graduate programs.

The Graduate Certificate in Health Care Commercialization (HGC) is a unique program designed for individuals with a science background who aspire to become a part of the leadership in their business or organization. Students who earn a health care commercialization certificate will learn the business and legal aspects of taking a product from the discovery to market. Graduates will gain the skills to navigate the regulatory process, create and defend intellectual property, and to lead teams through the phases of product commercialization.
CostPerCredit: Kentucky Resident: $681; Metro/Reciprocity: $749; Non-Resident: $1,029 per credit hour
ScholarshipType: Graduate Assistantships, Merit-based Scholarships, Research Grants

EnglishScore: All international applicants for whom English is not their native language must provide evidence of English proficiency. This can be demonstrated by one of the following: a TOEFL score of 73 iBT (with minimum subscores of 15), IELTS score of 6.0 (with no subscore below 5.5), Duolingo English Test score of 100, ELS Language Centers completion of Level 112, or PTE Academic score of 49.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The graduate certificate in Health Informatics provides an interdisciplinary approach to health informatics, combining expertise from computer science, data science, business informatics, and health sciences. Students learn to use information technology to organize and analyze health data and records to improve healthcare outcomes. The program provides the foundational knowledge and skills for a career or advancement in the field of health informatics.
ScholarshipType: Graduate Assistantships, Graduate Scholarships, Tuition Incentive Program

EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate a minimum level of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include TOEFL iBT 79, IELTS 6.5, PTE 58, Duolingo 110, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Description: The Information Systems Certificate program is designed to provide you with a graduate level curriculum in the information systems area. The program provides the foundational knowledge to effectively integrate information technology into business strategy, business process re-design, decision-making, and organizational design. The information systems curriculum provides technical knowledge of the tools and technologies used to manage organizational data and knowledge resources. You will also develop skills in systems analysis and design to identify business problems and develop technological solutions. The program prepares you to manage information systems projects by providing knowledge of project management principles, concepts, tools, and techniques. The program can be completed in as little as three semesters, and the certificate is offered completely online. The Information Systems Graduate Certificate can serve as a stackable certificate for the MBA program.
Accredidation: The Haile College of Business has AACSB International accreditation for both our business and accounting programs - a distinction held by only 1% of business schools worldwide.

EnglishScore:
You must provide proof of English proficiency by one of the following:

TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) – Score of 79 (Internet Based Test), 550 (Paper Based Test), or 213 (Computer Based Test)
IELTS (International English Language Testing System) – Score of 6.0
ELS (English Language Services) – Level 112 with a grade of B or higher
Duolingo English Test - Score of 105
PTE (Pearson Test of English Academic) - Score of 55
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Literary and Cultural Studies is designed for students interested in developing the critical reading and writing skills necessary to succeed as secondary educators, doctoral students, and leaders in other professions. The certificate requires four graduate English courses (12 credit hours). Students can also choose to earn the certificate as a part of the MA in English program.
CostPerCredit: Kentucky Resident: $665; Ohio Reciprocity (Metro)/Indiana Reciprocity: $735; Non-Resident: $960

Requirements: The admission requirements are the same as the Master of Public Administration program. To be admitted to the certificate program, applicants must hold a baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Applicants with a GPA between 2.5 and 2.99 may be admitted on a conditional basis. The following items must be submitted for admission: An online application and application fee, official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended, a current resume (Vita), a statement of purpose that describes the applicant’s personal and professional goals and how the MPA degree will help them achieve their goals, and three letters of recommendation.
Description: The Nonprofit Management & Leadership Certificate is a 15-credit hour undergraduate certificate that introduces students to the essential concepts and skills necessary for managing and leading nonprofit organizations. This certificate program will teach students how to: (1) analyze the unique environment of nonprofit organizations, including their public service role, funding, and relationship with government, business, and community; (2) lead and manage staff and volunteers effectively in a nonprofit organization; (3) conduct fundraising for a nonprofit organization, and (4) analyze, develop and manage budgets and other financial documents in a nonprofit organization. The certificate is especially useful for students in a variety of fields who are interested in employment or volunteer work in the nonprofit sector, including social work, human services, public relations, business, criminal justice, organizational leadership, and fine arts.

EnglishScore: International students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following to meet the English proficiency requirement: a score of 79 or higher on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT); a score of 550 or higher on the paper-based TOEFL (PBT); a score of 6.0 or higher on the IELTS; successful completion of level 112 of the ELS Language Centers Program; a score of 105 or higher on the Duolingo English Test; or a score of 58 or higher on the PTE Academic.
Requirements: In addition to the university graduate admission requirements, the Post-Master’s DNP Nurse Practitioner Certificate program requires: An official transcript from an ACEN or CCNE accredited nursing program with conferred master’s degree in nursing (MSN) or a doctor of nursing practice (DNP). A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on all previous graduate work. An unencumbered, active RN license in the state where clinicals will be completed. A current resume or curriculum vitae. A personal statement (500-1000 words) describing the applicant’s professional goals and how the DNP Nurse Practitioner certificate program will help them achieve those goals and what personal attributes they possess that will contribute to their success in the program. Also, if GPA is less than 3.2, explain the circumstances and how they have been addressed. Two professional recommendations. A successful interview with program faculty may be required. Evidence of completion of a graduate-level statistics course with a grade of a 'B' or higher within the last five years is required for all certificate programs. This course must be completed prior to taking NUR 800. Post-MSN FNP applicants must have one year of full-time practice experience as an RN prior to applying to the program. Post-MSN AGACNP applicants must have one year of full-time practice in an acute care setting prior to applying to the program. Post-MSN PMHNP applicants must have one year of full-time practice as an RN prior to applying to the program.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Concentration: Family Nurse Practitioner, Adult Gero Primary Care Nurse Practitioner
Description: Northern Kentucky University's post-master's nurse practitioner advancement certificate allows master's prepared nurse practitioners to expand their scope of practice. The online coursework and clinical experience will expand your marketability to provide primary care services to a new population focus. At NKU, we offer two nurse practitioner population focus areas: Family Nurse Practitioner and Adult Gero Primary Care Nurse Practitioner. The program is flexible with full-time and part-time options. Our curriculum is tailored to your individual needs based on a gap analysis of your previous graduate coursework. The program is offered fully online with the exception of on-campus immersion events for skills training and competency validation.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and doctor of nursing practice program at Northern Kentucky University are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).
CostPerCredit: $744 per credit hour (Resident), $844 per credit hour (Metro), $944 per credit hour (Non-Resident)

ProgramName: Post-Master of Science in Nursing Certificate
EnglishScore: Applicants must satisfy the English language proficiency requirements of the university for graduate students. This can be fulfilled by holding a bachelor's degree or higher from a regionally accredited U.S. institution or a recognized institution in a country where English is an official language, or by submitting minimum official scores: TOEFL 79 (iBT) or 550 (PBT), IELTS 6.5, Duolingo 105, PTE Academic 53, or by completing ELS Language Center's level 112.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Fees: $8,868 - $15,462 for the entire program, depending on residency and credit hours.
Concentration: ['Adult-Geron Acute Care Nurse Practitioner', 'Adult-Geron Primary Care Nurse Practitioner', 'Family Nurse Practitioner', 'Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner', 'Nurse Executive Leadership', 'Nursing Education']
Description: Northern Kentucky University's online Post-Master's Certificate programs prepare you to move into a new specialty in the nursing field or advance your position where you're already working. Choose from a variety of tracks to fit your career goals. This program is for nurses who already hold a master's or doctoral degree in nursing and are nationally certified and licensed as an advanced practice registered nurse (APRN).
Accredidation: The post-master’s APRN certificate program at Northern Kentucky University is pursuing initial accreditation by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street, NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, 202-887-6791. Applying for accreditation does not guarantee that accreditation will be granted.
CollegeApplicationFee: $8,868 - $15,462 for the entire program, depending on residency and credit hours.

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-native English speaking countries must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL (73 internet-based), IELTS (6.0), Duolingo (100), ELS Language Center (Completion of Level 112), or PTE (49).
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Professional Writing at Northern Kentucky University is a 15-credit-hour program that introduces students to advanced research, theory, and the practice of professional writing. Grounded in rhetorical theory, the coursework combines research with the practical application of writing and editing skills. The certificate is offered completely online, though students may opt to take some classes on campus. This certificate is a perfect fit for professionals looking to enhance their credentials and skills in business writing, scientific and technical writing, medical writing, editing, and publishing. The Graduate Certificate in Professional Writing also prepares students for graduate study in professional writing at the M.A. or Ph.D. level.
ScholarshipType: Graduate Assistantships, Tuition Incentive Program (TIP), Diversity Scholarship

EnglishScore: All international graduate applicants from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This requirement can be satisfied by submitting one of the following official test scores: TOEFL iBT score of 79, IELTS score of 6.0, PTE Academic score of 53, Duolingo English Test score of 105, or completion of ELS Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA. The requirement is waived for applicants who have completed a degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution or a recognized university in a country where English is the official language, among other exemptions.
Requirements:
Applicants must meet the admission requirements of the Graduate School. In addition, applicants should also meet the following program requirements:

- Bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better on a 4.0 scale.
- Applicants with a GPA lower than a 3.0 may be considered for conditional admission.
- Submission of all postsecondary transcripts.
- No GRE is required.
- A statement of purpose.
- A professional resume.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Total Worker Health (TWH) is an innovative program that can be completed entirely online. The certificate program will train students in the principles of TWH, a holistic approach that integrates protection from work-related safety and health hazards with promotion of injury and illness-prevention efforts to advance worker well-being. TWH builds on this approach through the recognition that work is a social determinant of health, since job-related factors such as wages, hours of work, workload and stress levels, interactions with coworkers and supervisors, and access to paid leave and health-promoting workplaces can have an important impact on the well-being of workers, their families, and their communities.

EnglishScore: NKU requires one of the following for all applicants for whom English is not their native language: A score of 73 on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) internet-based test (iBT); A score of 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS); Successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112 with a grade of at least a B; A score of 100 on the Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: Admission requirements for all special education graduate options (MAT, Rank I, Endorsements, Alternative Routes to Certification): Application to the graduate school, which includes: Official transcripts from all universities and/or colleges attended; A cumulative undergraduate GPA of at least 2.75 on a 4.0 scale or a GPA of at least 3.00 on the last thirty (30) hours of credit completed, including undergraduate and graduate coursework; Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can attest to your potential for success in graduate school; A two-page, double-spaced essay describing your dispositions for teaching, commitment to the profession of special education, and long-term career goals; A passing score on the Praxis Core Academic Skills for Educators Tests (CORE) or meet the GRE waiver score; A clean state and federal background check; A signed Professional Code of Ethics/Character and Fitness document; Admission to Teacher Education.
Concentration: Learning and Behavior Disorders (LBD), Moderate to Severe Disabilities (MSD)
Description: The Alternative Certification in Special Education program at Northern Kentucky University is a graduate-level program that allows a student to receive a Temporary Provisional Certificate in Learning and Behavior Disorders (LBD) or Moderate to Severe Disabilities (MSD) and teach while completing the requirements for the Professional Certificate. The program offers a non-degree option, or the student may pursue a Master of Arts in Teaching (MAT) degree. The program is specifically designed to meet the needs of those who have a bachelor's degree in a field other than education and have been hired to teach special education in a Kentucky school district.
Accredidation: NKU's educator preparation programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and the Kentucky Education Professional Standards Board (EPSB).

Requirements: Application to the Graduate School. Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended showing a Master's degree from an accredited institution with a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A valid Kentucky teaching certificate or statement of eligibility for a Kentucky teaching certificate for all teaching certificates. Three years of full-time teaching experience. A letter of recommendation from the applicant’s current building principal or supervisor. A completed character and fitness form. A writing sample detailing reasons for seeking admission to the Director of Pupil Personnel Program. A satisfactory interview with the Director of Pupil Personnel Admissions Committee.
Description: The Director of Pupil Personnel (DPP) certification program is designed to prepare candidates to manage attendance, accounting of all pupils, visiting teacher services, and school social work services. The DPP works with students who have problems with attendance and connects them with services both within the school system and the community to foster their academic and personal success. At NKU, this certification is a 12 credit hour online program that offers an option for candidates to earn the Supervisor of Instruction certification with the addition of one 3 credit hour course.
Accredidation: The teacher education programs at Northern Kentucky University are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

Requirements: To be admitted to the superintendent program, you must have: A master's degree from a regionally accredited institution, with a minimum graduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale; Completed application packet to the Graduate Office; A valid Kentucky Professional Certificate for Teaching, Level II or III; Statement of Rank I; Official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended sent directly to the Graduate Office; Written statement of purpose for seeking superintendent certification; Three letters of recommendation (one must be from current superintendent or designee); Resume documenting leadership experiences; Successful interview with the admissions committee.
Description: The Educational Leadership program at NKU offers post-master’s certifications for school principals, supervisors of instruction, directors of special education and school superintendents. The program prepares educational leaders to be collaborative and transformative to promote the success of all students. The School Superintendent Certification prepares candidates for the district-level leadership role of the school superintendent.
Accredidation: Northern Kentucky University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC). The Educational Leadership programs are state-approved and accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

Fees: $20,970 (Total estimated tuition for Kentucky residents based on 30 credit hours at $699/credit hour)
Description: The Rank I program at Northern Kentucky University offers a planned program for teachers who have a master's degree and a valid teaching certificate. The program is designed to provide teachers with a program that is specifically designed to meet their professional development goals. The Rank I program leads to a salary increase in the state of Kentucky.
Accredidation: The College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
ScholarshipType: Graduate Assistantships, Graduate Student Scholarships, External Scholarships
